sections.title: What is it ?
sections.text: Belle Epoque's last website was outdated, so they decided to create a new site showing a new set of skills recently acquired. Vincent Le Vern took care of the design of the site and Michael de Laborde and myself, working as apprentices at Belle Epoque, took care of the development.
This new website features textured 3D abstract shapes that I enjoyed creating. I also had fun set up the small UI and 3D interactions that make navigating the site fun.

sections.title: Tech
sections.text: As for all projects made by Belle Epoque, we use NextJS and we added React Three Fiber to manage ThreeJS and Framer Motion for animations. In addition to being an animation lib, Framer Motion also allows for high frequency reactivity that is difficult to manage in a React application. This stack was really nice to use, even though React Three Fiber often leads to overly verbose code.
